subject: MCUTempSensor: Support read Byte data
commitMessage:
MCUTempSensor: Support read Byte data

- Original the MCUTempSensor in dbus-sensors only can read "Word" data
  currently, so we modified it to support read Byte data.

  Byte Mode: Using i2c_smbus_read_byte_data function to read byte data,
             and save to dbus.

- Add "ScaleValue" parameter to replace the hardcore value 1000.
  Because the data may be a degree value.

TEST:
Add sensor config to entity-manager json:
        {
            "Bus": 12,
            "Address": "0x30",
            "Reg": "0x40",
            "I2cMode": "Byte",
            "Class": "MCUTemp",
            "Name": "MCUIC",
            "ScaleValue": 1,
            "Thresholds": [
                {
                    "Direction": "greater than",
                    "Name": "upper critical",
                    "Severity": 1,
                    "Value": 84.0
                }
            ],
            "Type": "MCUTempSensor"
        }

Signed-off-by: Harvey.Wu <Harvey.Wu@quantatw.com>
Change-Id: Ieb8fa97f9042156e9c4231c659c445b40ee303e3

Should we use enum class? 

Also, instead of move a copy, using a const reference is more common.
Done.
The capacity of "pu16data" is 2 bytes. So it is either a word or a byte. Why do we need the "block" option?

I'm not sure about other MCU sensors. But in my system, the MCU sensor's temp only can be read via reading block data, so I add "Block" option to get direct byte data.

The i2c_smbus_read_i2c_block_data input parameter val have to a uint8 pointer(https://elixir.bootlin.com/linux/latest/source/drivers/i2c/i2c-core-smbus.c#L267).
The function will save numbers of uint8 byte data to val according length.
And I get the last byte data saving to *pu16data.
don't we have a overflow here?

Do you mean the overflow bit? or detect overflow value?
I'm not sure about overflow bit, because every MCU sensor may have different overflow bit.
About overflow value, I think it can be detected via setting threshold by user.
should we report invalid argument earlier here instead of when reading data?
Thanks for suggestion. Done.
Is this already defined in Entity Manager's schema?

Not yet. It seems "Reg", "Mode" and "Length" are not defined in schema currently.
I'm not familiar with schema. It means all properties in json have to pre-define in the schema?
Please refer here: https://github.com/openbmc/entity-manager/blob/master/schemas/README.schema#L56

I commit the PR to add schemas properties.
https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/entity-manager/+/49287
I change the name "Mode" to "I2cMode", "Length" to "DataOffset".
This should depend on modeStr now
Done.
What do you want return? This does not look right.

I want to get direct byte data and save to dbus.
For example, if length is 2, which means get 2 block byte data, the val will save the get result like (0x01 0x2f). I want to save 0x2f to dbus
What is the use case for reading block data, only to keep one byte and throw away the rest?

Yes. In our system's microcontroller temperature, it's in a high byte data in register. If using i2c reading word data, the return value will like 0x2f01. So I want to use read block data to get direct byte data.

< So I want to use read block data to get direct byte data.

To me, it is not intuitively obvious that Block mode is used to get the last single byte data, not the whole block of data. If currently, there is no need to return the data differently with Block mode, please add comments to clarify in the code.

Hi Zhikui, thanks for the discussion. After serious consideration, I think I can use "Word" mode and another method to achieve my purpose.
About "Block" mode, do you have any suggestions? I will try to modify to save the whole data to dbus first.
Or maybe remove "Block" mode, only use "Byte" and "Word" mode?
I am OK with leave the block mode out for now if there is no need.
Removed the "Block" mode, updated to only use "Byte" and "Word" mode.
Make sure this is not 0 or overflow?
Done. Checking the input scale value is not 0 in the beginning.
To be backwards compatible, make "Byte" as default if these entries do not exist
Done.
Push this as separate patch, as it has nothing to do with title of commit "Support read Byte data"
This is just configuration change, update how it was tested. In byte as well as word case.

Code does not look backwards compatible with old Baseboard.json file. 
Assume a case when "I2cMode" is not defined, in that case default to Word, so that this code is backwards compatible and making sure merge won't break any existing functionality.
